definition: Nü Shu writing, a phonetic syllabary for Yao ethnic group 瑶族 瑤族 dialect designed and used by women in Jiangyong county 江永縣|江永县 in southern Hunan
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Nü Shu works are folklores which have special fascination.
sentences.chinese: 女书作品是有着独特魅力的民间文学。

sentences.english: In 2006, Jiangyong Women's script is registered as world cultural legacy.
sentences.chinese: 2006年中国女书申报世界文化遗产。

sentences.english: Womanese script has been praised as the world's most gender-sensitive language.
sentences.chinese: 女书文字被评价为是世界上最具性别意识的文字。

sentences.english: However, as the development of the times, accordingly Nü Shu need not been used by women.
sentences.chinese: 但是随着时代的发展，女书面临着濒临灭绝的境地。

definition: Hunan embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
batik (color printing on cloth using wax)
papercutting (Chinese folk art)/to make paper cutouts
poetry and pictorial art/work of art combining pictures and poetry
Dongba culture of the Nakhi ethnic group of Lijiang 麗江|丽江 in northwest Yunnan

pinyin: Fei1 wu4 zhi4 Wen2 hua4 Yi2 chan3

definition: Hmong or Miao ethnic group of southwest China
ballad tune in southern dialects, usually to sanxian 三弦 or pipa 琵琶 accompaniment
